Sentence.sentence: The current low fossil fuel price environment will thus certainly delay the energy transition from fossil fuel to clean energy sources.

Sentence.sentence: Renewables account for only a small share of global primary energy consumption, which is still dominated by fossil fuels—30% each for coal and oil, 25% for natural gas.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Policymakers should not allow low energy prices to derail the clean energy transition.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Notwithstanding important recent progress in developing renewable fuel sources, low fossil fuel prices could discourage further innovation in, and adoption of, cleaner energy technologies.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If not corrected by the appropriate carbon price, low fossil fuel prices are not accurately signaling to markets the true social profitability of clean energy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Fossil fuels remain the major source of primary energy consumption in today's world.

Sentence.sentence: For example, the United Arab Emirates has endorsed an ambitious target to draw 24% of its primary energy consumption from renewable sources by 2021.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Even major fossil fuel exporting countries have great potential to develop renewable energies.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Coal and natural gas are mainly used for electricity generation, whereas oil is used mostly to power transportation, yet the prices of all these energy sources are linked.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: By raising relative demand for clean energy sources, a carbon price would also help align the market return to clean-energy innovation with its social return, spurring the refinement of existing technologies and the development of new ones.

Sentence.sentence: But renewable energy will have to displace fossil fuels to a much greater extent in the future to avoid unacceptable climate risks.

Sentence.sentence: When you hear people speaking of making a rapid transition toward any type of energy, whether it is a switch from coal to nuclear power, or a switch from gasoline-powered cars to electric cars, or even a switch from an incandescent to a fluorescent light, understanding energy system inertia and momentum can help you decide whether their plans are feasible.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Unfortunately for them ( ' , and often the taxpayers), our energy systems are a bit like an aircraft carrier: they are unbelievably expensive, they are built to last for a very long time, they have a huge amount of inertia ( ' , meaning it takes a lot of energy to set them moving), and they have a lot of momentum once they are set in motion.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

sameAnalysis.word_list: energy, force, power, might, strength, vigour
means: energy ： 用于人时，指工作时焕发出的精力或干劲。
force ： 着重指克服障碍，推动人或物朝所要求的方向运动或能产生明显效应的力量。
power ： 最普通用词，泛指一切力量或能力等。
might ： 多指巨大或超人的力量。
strength ： 指机体内部的能力，是依靠身体组织而存在的力，经使用就变为force。
vigour ： 指由生命元气的存在所产生的活力、精力。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 精力旺盛的;积极的;有力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: energy[n.活力,精力;能,能量]+etic属于……的→energetic精力旺盛的
an无+ergy能量,活动→n.[医]无反应力,无力
en进入+ergy能量,活动→充满力量
energy[n.活力,精力;能,能量]+ize表动词→energize给与……能量

word_mean: 产生运动、克服阻力和影响物理变化的力量
能量蛋白比: protein ratio 每千克饲料所含的能量（焦耳）与该饲料粗蛋白百分含量之比值。
能量动量张量: energy-momentum tensor  简称“能动张量”。
生命系统的基础和生态系统的动力, 一切生命活动都存在着的能量流动和转化。

means.word_mean: 活力, 干劲, 能力

sentences.en: He is full of energy.
sentences.cn: 他充满了活力。

sentences.en: As people approach old age, their energies may diminish.
sentences.cn: 接近老年时, 人的精力就衰退了。

means.word_mean: 【物理学】(原子、电、辐射的)能，能量，(可利用)能量(如电能、热能等)

sentences.en: Plants absorb energy from the sun.
sentences.cn: 植物吸收太阳的能量。

means.word_mean: 表达力；(语言、文体、文笔等的)生动有力
(足够的或充沛的)活气，元气，气力
精力充沛的行动习惯；充满活力的特征

sentence.cn: 没有人会知道天才、雄心、活力和运气是如何造就了狄更斯这样一位杰出的作家。
sentence.en: No one will ever know what mix of talent, ambition, energy and luck made Dickens such a distinguished writer.
sentence.from: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

sentence.cn: 生产它们需要更多的能量。
sentence.from: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

entry.def: Energy is the ability and strength to do active physical things and the feeling that you are full of physical power and life.

example.ex: He was saving his energy for next week's race in Belgium...
example.tran: 他正为下周在比利时的比赛养精蓄锐。

example.ex: We try to boost our energy by eating.
example.tran: 我们试图通过吃东西来增强体力。

entry.def: Energy is determination and enthusiasm about doing things.

example.ex: At 54 years old her energy and looks are magnificent...
example.tran: 她54岁了，精力和气色都非常好。

example.ex: You have drive and energy for those things you are interested in.
example.tran: 你对那些感兴趣的事情干劲十足。

entry.def: Your energies are your efforts and attention, which you can direct towards a particular aim.

example.ex: She had started to devote her energies to teaching rather than performing...
example.tran: 她已经开始将精力从表演转移到教学中。

example.ex: We must concentrate our energies on treating addiction first.
example.tran: 我们必须首先集中精力治疗毒瘾。

entry.def: Energy is the power from sources such as electricity and coal that makes machines work or provides heat.

example.tran: 那些支持利用核能的人

example.ex: Oil shortages have brought on an energy crisis...
example.tran: 石油短缺已经造成了能源危机。

means.word_mean: 1. (physics) the capacity of a physical system to do work; the units of energy are joules or ergs;

sentences.sentence: "energy can take a wide variety of forms"

means.word_mean: 4. an imaginative lively style (especially style of writing);
5. a healthy capacity for vigorous activity;

sentences.sentence: "he seemed full of vim and vigor"

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting force or vigour of expression): from French énergie, or via late Latin from Greek energeia, from en- 'in, within' + ergon 'work'
